benchmark_details.name: D-REX (Deceptive Reasoning Exposure Suite)
benchmark_details.overview: D-REX is a benchmark designed to evaluate the discrepancy between a model's internal reasoning process and its final output, focusing on detecting deceptive reasoning in large language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To address the critical issue of deceptive reasoning in large language models and facilitate the development of safety mechanisms.

data.source: Constructed through a competitive red-teaming exercise

methodology.calculation: Based on the performance of models against specific deceptive reasoning criteria.
methodology.interpretation: Models are judged on their ability to camouflaged malicious intent while generating benign outputs.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison against other benchmarks, but no specific baselines reported.
